            I am a UC Irvine Statistics PhD student and my research
            interests include:
            statistics and data science education and
            accessibility
            epidemiological applications of statistics to better
            understand disease and infection
            My current methodological work is in improvement of
            phylodynamic estimation methods.
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Catalina Mari Medina

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Current
projects
Publications
Packages
COVID-19 Trends by UC
Irvine website

Current projects
Quantifying and mitigating the impact of reporting delay of genetic
sequences in phylodynamic analyses.
Geostatistical exploration of factors related to Aedes
mosquito exposure among Cambodian children. Manuscript in
process
gradetools
package manuscript: Automated grading workflow for personalized feedback
with gradetools
Publications
Parker DM, Bruckner T, Vieira VM, Medina C, Minin
VN, Felgner PL, et al. Epidemiology of the early COVID-19 epidemic,
Orange County, California, USA. Emerging Infectious Diseases. 2021
Oct. https://doi.org/10.3201/eid2710.210103.
Packages
The gradetools
R package was created with data science instructors in
mind. Assessing students with open-ended assignments (e.g. projects,
interpretation questions) can be impactful but can also be arduous when
it comes to grading. gradetools helps automate the grading workflow and
facilitates in creating individualized assignment feedback for
students.
COVID-19 Trends by UC
Irvine website
Created and maintain animated maps of COVID-19 case incidence, tests,
and positivity in Orange County for the COVID-19 Trends by UC
Irvine website created by the UC Irvine COVID Awareness group.

articles.title: Teaching experience
articles.description: My teaching experience at UNR and UCI as a instructor of record, teaching assistant, and grader.
articles.contents:
Contents
Instructor of Record
UCI (University of
California, Irvine)
UNR (University of Nevada,
Reno)

Teaching
assistant
UCI

Grader
UCI


Instructor of Record
UCI (University of
California, Irvine)
Basic Statistics (Stats 7) 2022 Summer Session: 
Introduces basic inferential statistics including confidence intervals
and hypothesis testing on means and proportions, t-distribution, Chi
Square, regression and correlation. F-distribution and nonparametric
statistics included if time permits.
UNR (University of Nevada,
Reno)
Intermediate Algebra (Math 96) 2019 Summer:
Basic properties of the real numbers; standard algebraic techniques,
including exponents, factoring, fractions, radicals; problem solving;
linear and quadratic equations; the concept of graphing.
Elementary Algebra (Math 95) 2019 Summer:
Preparation for Intermediate Algebra. Topics include the fundamental
operations on real numbers, inequalities in one variable, polynomials,
integer exponents, and solving quadratic equations by factoring.
Teaching assistant
UCI
Irvine Summer Institute in Biostatistics and
Undergraduate Data Science (ISI-BUDS) 2022 Summer: 
ISI-BUDS is a six-week summer program introducing undergraduate students
to modern methodology and practice of biostatistics and data science.
The program highlights applications in cutting edge biomedical research,
trains students in fundamentals of biostatistics, data science, and
computing, and culminates in a team project co-supervised by
statisticians and biomedical scientists.
Statistical Methods for Data Analysis I (Stats
110) 2021 Summer:
Introduction to statistical methods for analyzing data from experiments
and surveys. Methods covered include two-sample procedures, analysis of
variance, simple and multiple linear regression.
Introduction to Probability and Statistics I
(Stats 120A) 2020 Summer:
Introduction to basic principles of probability and statistical
inference. Axiomatic definition of probability, random variables,
probability distributions, expectation.
Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Computer
Science (Stats 67) 2020 Spring:
Introduction to the basic concepts of probability and statistics with
discussion of applications to computer science.
Statistical Methods for Data Analysis II (Stats
111) 2019 Winter:
Introduction to statistical methods for analyzing data from surveys or
experiments. Emphasizes application and understanding of methods for
categorical data including contingency tables, logistic and Poisson
regression, loglinear models.
Introduction to Biological Statistics (Stats 8)
2019 Fall:
Introductory statistical techniques used to collect and analyze
experimental and observational data from health sciences and biology.
Includes exploration of data, probability and sampling distributions,
basic statistical inference for means and proportions, linear
regression, and analysis of variance
Grader
UCI
Introduction to Probability and Statistics for Computer
Science (Stats 67) 2020 Spring:
Introduction to the basic concepts of probability and statistics with
discussion of applications to computer science.
